column1: 2 ^ Domine in virtūte tuā laetābitur rēx, et super salūtāre tuum exsultābit vehementer. ^ In thy strength, O Lord, the king shall joy
column2: and in thy salvation he shall rejoice exceedingly.

column1: 3 ^ Dēsīderium cordis ejus tribuistī eī, et voluntāte labiōrum ejus nōn fraudāvistī eum. ^ Thou hast given him his heart's desire, and hast not withholden from him the will of his lips.
4 ^ Quoniam praevēnistī eum in benedictiōnibus dulcēdinis
column2: posuistī in capite ejus corōnam dē lapide pretiōsō. ^ For thou hast prevented him with blessings of sweetness
column3: thou hast set on his head a crown of precious stones.

column1: 5 ^ Vītam petīvit ā tē, et tribuistī eī longitūdinem diērum in saeculum, et in saeculum saeculī. ^ He asked life of thee, and thou hast given him length of days for ever and ever.
6 ^ Magna est glōria ejus in salūtārī tuō
column2: glōriam et magnum decōrem impōnēs super eum. ^ His glory is great in thy salvation
column3: glory and great beauty shalt thou lay upon him.

column1: 7 ^ Quoniam dabis eum in benedictiōnem in saeculum saeculī
column2: laetificābis eum in gaudiō cum vultū tuō. ^ For thou shalt give him to be a blessing for ever and ever
column3: thou shalt make him joyful in gladness with thy countenance.

column1: 8 ^ Quoniam rēx spērat in Dominō, et in misericordiā Altissimī nōn commovēbitur. ^ For the king hopeth in the Lord, and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.
9 ^ Inveniātur manus tua omnibus inimīcīs tuīs
column2: dextera tua inveniat omnēs, quī tē ōdērunt. ^ Let thy hand be found by all thy enemies
column3: let thy right hand find out all them that hate thee.

column1: 10 ^ Pōnēs eōs ut clībanum ignis in tempore vultūs tuī
column2: Dominus in īrā suā conturbābit eōs, et dēvorābit eōs ignis. ^ Thou shalt make them as an oven of fire in the time of thy presence
column3: the Lord shall trouble them in his wrath, and fire shall devour them.

column1: 11 ^ Fructum eōrum dē terrā perdēs, et sēmen eōrum ā fīliīs hominum. ^ Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.

column2: cōgitāvērunt consilia quae nōn potuērunt stabilīre. ^ For they have intended evils against thee
column3: they have devised counsels which they have not been able to establish.

column2: in reliquiīs tuīs praeparābis vultum eōrum. ^ For thou shalt make them turn their back
column3: in thy remnants thou shalt prepare their face.

column2: cantābimus et psallēmus virtūtēs tuās. ^ Be thou exalted, O Lord, in thy own strength
column3: we will sing and praise thy power.
